verses.text: Come, and let us return to the LORD: for he hath torn, and he will heal us; he hath smitten, and he will bind us up.
After two days will he revive us: in the third day will he raise us up, and we shall live in his sight.
Then shall we know, \add if\add* we follow on to know the LORD: his going forth is prepared as the morning; and he will come to us as the rain, as the latter \add and\add* former rain to the earth.
O Ephraim, what shall I do to thee? O Judah, what shall I do to thee? for your goodness \add is\add* as the morning cloud, and as the early dew it goeth away.
Therefore have I hewed \add them\add* by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of my mouth: and thy judgments \add are as\add* the light \add that\add* goeth forth.
For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice: and the knowledge of God more than burnt-offerings.
But they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.
Gilead \add is\add* a city of them that work iniquity, \add and is\add* polluted with blood.
And as troops of robbers wait for a man, \add so\add* the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.
I have seen a horrible thing in the house of Israel: there \add is\add* the prostitution of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
Also, O Judah, he hath set a harvest for thee, when I returned the captivity of my people.
